properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildWatford boy, born and bred.

properties.name: 159 Otterburn Close
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild The squat I legalised under a false name before it was demolished. Lived here from September 1990 - July 1992.

properties.name: 239 Harwoods Road, Watford
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild My home until I was 18 (1969-1988).

properties.name: 85 Cherbury Court
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Home for 18 months or so, October 2002 - June 2004. Lived with Daniel Moden (the brother of a colleague, Becky) and then Vicky Marsh.

properties.name: 9th April: 19 year old shot in head
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildA 19-year-old was hit in the head in Harold Road, Plaistow, east London, and is critically ill in a London Hospital.

properties.name: A beautiful bungee dive
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild 40 metres above a pool looking out into the Pacific, Dec 31st 2000 on my Mexican holiday with Jun.

properties.name: A climb too far
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild After Uyuni we had a couple of nights here before heading into Peru. One morning I went for a walk and ended up at pukará de quitor with no money on me. I went round the back and climbed about two-thirds of the way up but chickened out and just got dirty coming back down.

properties.name: A couple of nights before Route 40 South
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild We hitchiked across the border from Futaleufu with Juan - a flyfisherman - and Patrick - a rafter. Juan drove us through Welsh-speaking Trevlin to Esquel, where he dropped us at a hostel whose owner he knew. Leaving two nights later, we met Clay at the bus station.

properties.name: A couple of nights with a pool
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild

properties.name: A day in bed
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild After walking through the strike barricades on the road from Arequipa, we slept the ealry morning and some of the afternoon before making the rest of our journey to Qosqo.

properties.name: A hotel somewhere near Xian
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild

properties.name: A kiosk-like shop inside Galerias La Merced
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Has the usual Inca etc new books plus a small selection of second-hand novels.

properties.name: A night in Osaka
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild

properties.name: A year at my third school
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Went to Queens school in Sept 86 after I couldn\'t do the A-levels i wanted at Durrants. Stayed a year (to June 87) and never really fitted in, perhaps due to starting in Miami Vice style clothes...

properties.name: Against the strike and violence
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild

properties.name: Albert Town
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild

properties.name: Alexandrina
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Off an unsealed road, we found a little National campsite in the dark and later saw a hedgehog. Walked up a hill the following morning before heading north.

properties.name: Amazon Cases, Unit 11, WortonHall Industrial Estate, Worton Road
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildDesign and manufacture of protective cases, 19 inch racks, bags and covers; providing safe transport, storage, handling and deployment of military equipment.

properties.name: Ametek Aerospace and Defence, 111 Windmill Road
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildMiscellaneous Aircraft Accessories and Components

properties.name: An Advancing Glacier
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild The Perito Moreno glacier is one of the few accessible advancing glaciers in the world. We watched parts fall off over a few hours and imagined how we would best exploit it for tourists (huge projector, golf targets, etc).

properties.name: Anfield, Liverpool.
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild11th January 2005. Carling Cup Semi-Final First Leg. Jun and I came up by train and stayed in a hotel overnight. We went down 1-0.

properties.name: Anguilla, the Carribean
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild

properties.name: Another lake and volcano
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild First night in a school, second in Casa Azul. A pretty town with a German church.

properties.name: Asuwa High School, Fukui City
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Worked here for the school year August 1994 to July 1995 with Kusaoke sensei and Mori sensei.

properties.name: Ate at a record-breaking restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild A small restaurant on the corner of a Colonia street held the biggest barbecue in the world in 2008. We ate there 23rd April 2009.

properties.name: Awesome Falls
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Came from BA and saw Iguazu Falls from the Argentine side. We spotted a cayman, saw coatis for the first time as well as seeing loads of birds and butterflies. The falls themselves were the highlight though. After two nights here, we got a long bus to RIo.

properties.name: Awesome Glacier
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Perito Moreno, one of tyhe world´s only accessible advancing glaciers, cracks and breaks as it moves closer to you at the rate of about two metres a day. One of those few awesome sights.

properties.name: Ayahuasca
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild   In a cheap hotel for more than a week l, the latter part of which was spent travelling to km26, taking ayahuasca at night and coming back to rest during the day.

properties.name: Ayahuasca sleep-off
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Spent the night before our 3-night jungle trip doing ayahuasca with Alejandro, an acquaintance of Miguel Tang (whose boat is called "Pituco"). Then slept, did the trip, came back and did another ayahuasca ceremony followed by another mid-morning sleep.

properties.name: BA Stay
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild After a couple of nights at Downtown Maté, we moved into a departamento on Alsina for a month. We took this opportunity to see 5 or 6 Argentinian films, Jun kept studying, and later I met a madre. We nipped into Uruguay during this month and then left for Iguazu Falls and on to Rio.

properties.name: BAE & HAL Software, 4 New City Cloisters, 196 Old Street
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild

properties.name: BAE Avionics Group, The Grove, Warren Lane, Stanmore
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildBAE Systems Avionics boasts of specialising in developing world-class integrated sensor solutions for land, naval and airborne defence electronics requirements. It is a leader in airborne radars, and electro-optical surveillance, tracking, targeting and imaging systems. It has a complete capability for design, development, manufacture and in-service support. The Avionics Group has organised its core business activities into seven delivery focused sectors: Radar Electronic Warfare (EW) Laser Systems Battlespace & EO Advanced Projects Mission Systems Integration (MSI) Avionic Partnered Solutions (APS) The Grove, Warren Lane, Stanmore, Middlesex HA7 4LY, Tel: +44 (0) 208 954 2311 Fax: +44 (0) 208 420 3990

properties.name: BAE Systems, 6 Carlton Gardens
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildThe fourth largest arms company in the world has become synonymous with the term “slush fund”. The Serious Fraud Office’s investigation into BAE\'s massive Al-Yamamah deal with Saudi Arabia was halted on political grounds.

properties.name: BAE Systems, 6 Carlton Gardens
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildThe fourth largest arms company in the world has become synonymous with the term “slush fund”. The Serious Fraud Office’s investigation into BAE\'s massive Al-Yamamah deal with Saudi Arabia was halted on political grounds.

properties.name: BAE Systems, Apex Tower, 7 High Street, New Malden
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild

properties.name: BAE, Elstree Way, Borehamwood
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildBAE 0208 953 2030

properties.name: Back Garden Cabaña
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Stayed at 354 Belgrano, in Henry´s back garden, for a month. Jun studied at Patagonia School for 4 weeks and I studied for 1. Met Jo Nicholson as well as other students and teachers and staff at the school.

properties.name: Bag lost - momentary drama
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Two and a half hours walking with full packs from 4am meant that when we got to Qosqo about 10, we were both tired. Jun left her bag (with passports, cash and camera) in the taxi. The guy was honest enough to bring it back an hour later. Phew! Stayed at Hostal Centenario and Julie joined us the following night.

properties.name: Beer but little else
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild  Had high hopes for this little town but apart from enjoying the best fruit beers I´ve ever had, there was not much to say about the place. Another market? Hmmm..

properties.name: Began supporting Deportivo
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Visited Julio here in summer 1999 and he converted me to Deportivo as my Spanish football team.

properties.name: Beijing Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild

properties.name: Beitucheng Underground Station, Beijing
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild They have TVs on the platforms of Chinese underground stations and this is where I was when the good news was confirmed.

properties.name: Between stays
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Hotel Continental wasn´t a bad choice for a place before and after we headed to Coroico and the animal refuge.

properties.name: Birthplace
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Sixth November 1969, about 3am.

properties.name: Bitch at El Buho
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild From Qosqo, we got a night bus to Nazca, saw the lines and then got on a bus to Puno. We agreed a price at hotel El Buho, but the receptionist was a right bitch. After an argument with Julie, she tried to increase our room price, then changed our breakfast. As well as seeing the floating islands, Sillustani and more, we spent time in iPeru complaining about her.

properties.name: Blowholes and Pancake rocks
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild  Saw the sights (but missed the highlights by minutes) at Punakaiki and stayed at the firstof many private campsites. Sat on the beach at night for an hour or two.

properties.name: Boeing UK, 16 St. James's St.
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildBoeing\'s military aircraft include the F/A-18 Hornet, the F-15 Eagle, the C-17 Globemaster III transport, and the AH-64D Apache helicopter.

properties.name: Boy George told me to fuck off
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild I was at the Prince Lovesexy concert in Wembley Arena in 1988. During the interval, walking around the arena I spotted the former Culture Club frontman. Wearing a \'Boy\' cap at the time I pointed and said "Boy". He was not so gracious.

properties.name: Bribed policemen
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Had been desperate to go to the toilets signed as next to the Catedral Metropolitana but when we arrived they were all closed. Went round the back to the stink of piss and shit and add some liquid. When i finished two policemen, who had come round, beckoned me over and asked for "una trata". I obliged with the sum of about 50p.

properties.name: British Library, 26th July
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildSaw poetry and comedy (Shazia Mirza) with Rod, Air, Tim and Chenee while the "Sacred" exhibition was on.

properties.name: Bungeed 134m
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Jumped off the pod at Nevis, New Zealand´s highest bungy jump.

properties.name: Bury St. Edmunds, 21st & 22nd July
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildFrom Cambridge, Al drove us here and we stayed in the Dog & Partridge before seeing some of the town the following day.

properties.name: Cambridge, 21st July
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildAllen drove Sue, Jun and I up to a park and ride. Then we got a bus into the centre and saw Jesus College, Christ College and i had a go at punting.

properties.name: Came where nobody had come for over a thousand years
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Spent time exploring the ruins of the Mayan city of Tikal with Jun in late 2001.

properties.name: Cannonvale for Arlie Beach and the Whitsunday Islands
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild

properties.name: Carlyle Group, Lnasdome House, 57 Berkley Square
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild

properties.name: Carried Jun down the world's 3rd biggest pyramid on my back
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Lost a game of cards at the top of the Piramide del Sol at Teothihuacan and forfeited with a perilous descent that could\'ve cost both our lives. My legs hurt for 2 days.

properties.name: Caught a second thief
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Six months after catching a guy in Bayswater, I caught a female tea leaf on March 25th 2008. She\'d stolen from an Indian woman near Chapel Market and instead of grabbing her I just followed her with the police on the phone.

properties.name: Caught a thief
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Chased and caught a tea-leaf who\'d tried to nick the bag of a colleague at work. Called the police who came and arrested him. Got a follow-up letter saying he (Anthony Leach) had\'d been convicted at City of Westminster Magistrates Court and sentenced to 8 weeks in prison. It left me with mixed feelings.

properties.name: Ceniza 331
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild After we had to leave the flat on chaparro, we rented at a place advertised all over town. Jun was volunteering at Aldea Yanapay´s school, I was working at the Irish pub.

properties.name: Cheap Ikebukuro hotel
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Stayed in Ikebukuro and visited Koji in hospital four or five times.

properties.name: Chicha for the first time
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Pleasant Sucre was a colonial treat. The highlight was stumbling on Recoleta Church while indigenous locals were "waiting for the spirit" outside. We sat down and drank and chewed the leaf with them.

properties.name: Cobbled Colonia
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild During our stay in the flat in BA, we came by boat to Uruguay for 2 nights, the first of which we spent in a room next to the shop where the owner worked in Colonia. A pretty town with lots of vintage cars on the street, most of which were defunct.

properties.name: Colonial buildings and museums
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild  A few nights in the capital built in the desert. Saw Pachacamac and a couple of good museums.

properties.name: Corporate parking
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild After our hoped for destination was closed at 8pm, we turned back towards Wellington and stopped in expensive Lower Hutt.

properties.name: Could´ve killed a cassowary or two
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Driving in remote northern Queensland, 2 (endangered) cassowaries stepped onto the road in front of my hired car. They didn´t stop but luckily I did.

properties.name: Craven Cottage, Fulham
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild1st January 2007. Premiership. Joss and I got the train and walked from Hammersmith Station. I thought we were losing for most of the game but realised in the second-half that the early goal had been disallowed. 0-0.

properties.name: DESO
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildThe Government Arms Dealers. Civil Servants paid for by us to sell death.

properties.name: DESO, 30th July
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildCalled a protest in support of Disarm DSEi that was better attended than I thought and celebrated the closure of the government\'s arms dealers.

properties.name: Darwin, Australia
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildNext part of the evolution of this game...

properties.name: Dean Court, A.F.C. Bournemouth
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildBetween 1988 and 1991, Luther played for Bournemouth and scored an impressive 56 goals in 121 appearances for the club.

properties.name: Decorating Miami
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Painted rooms in art deco colours in August 1998 at Kaori and Brian\'s new

properties.name: Diving the reef
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Stayed in a very nice apartment complex with 3 pools while Jun did her PADI and I dived off a boat called Rum Runner.

properties.name: Doha, Qatar
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildHQ of Al Jazeera

properties.name: Drank in England's smallest pub
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Had a pint in the Nutshell with Jun, Sue & Allen on 21st July 2007.

properties.name: Durrants senior school, Croxley, Herts.
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild We were 11 and Joanne Phelps stuck her tongue into my mouth on the evening of a school disco. Fortunately,despite the surprise, it came naturally to me.

properties.name: Ealing, England
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildComedy factor.

properties.name: ExCeL Centre, (DSEi arms fair)
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildThe DSEi arms fair is due to take place at the ExCel Centre in Newham, East London between the 11th and 14th September 2007.

properties.name: Fell for a building
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild the guard let me into Casa Battlo to take some pics from the hall (this was before guided tours of the building) but it was really the facade that did it. Went back in 2007 with Joss and bored him with my desire to photo every nook and cranny.

properties.name: Fifteen below
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild  I spent the second night of our trip stripping down to naked despite the cold because I was burning up with altitude sickness. The location marker is only an approximation.

properties.name: Filbert Street, Leicester City
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild15th February 1982. FA Cup fifth round. Dad drove. After the match, which we lost 2-0, one of their fans consoled us with the promotion we looked sure to win and said they\'d take the cup. We agreed.

properties.name: First White Water Rafting
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildFeb 2002, Jun and I went rafting on a river near the Costa Rican border. Jun came off immediately after we\'d scoffed at how unchallenging it was.

properties.name: First concert in a foreign country
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Went over to visit Mandy Price in Paris in June 1989 and saw Prince\'s concert here.

properties.name: First helicopter flight
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Flew from Helsinki to Talinn in 18 minutes.

properties.name: First night in a campervan
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild We ended up parked in the road outside Anthony and Yulia\'s rented flat. Jun was not impressed.

properties.name: First taste of Bolivia
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild More like a Brazilian city, apparently, Santa Cruz was where we got off a long bus journey from Asuncion, Paraguay. Spent a couple of nights here, enjoyed the feel of the place but didn´t do much.

properties.name: First time white water rafting
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Jun and I went down a seemingly calm river and mocked it at the half way stage. Soon afterwards I nearly drowned trying to swim without a life jacket and Jun came off the raft as soon as we restarted.

properties.name: Fitzroy range
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild  After 36 hours on the bus from Esquel, we wanted to sleep. That afternoon we walked up to a view of the FitzRoy range and back.

properties.name: Flags and cables
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild From Rio, we got a twenty hour bus to Foz do Igaçu, crossed the bridge on foot into Paraguay, then caught another bus. Spent a few days in Asuncion, from where we made a day trip to Aregua.

properties.name: Floods up to my knees
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild It was raining when I got off the 24-hour bus journey from Hanoi, raining when I had caught up on some sleep, raining after I stayed in all day and that night. Wading around the town, I thought I might catch a disease. I didn\'t, but I did get a lot of "War and Peace" read.

properties.name: Fumaroles and hot springs
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild

properties.name: GKN, 7 Cleveland Row
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild

properties.name: Gateway to the glacier
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Perito Moreno glacier was awe-inspiring.

properties.name: Gateway to the penguins
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Stayed in a cheap hospedaje on our way to see Humboldts and Magellanic penguins.

properties.name: Gay Meadow, Shrewsbury Town
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild14th April, 1979. Old League Division 3. Bussed up with Gadeside Rangers, my football team, to see Ian Bolton score our goal in a 1-1 draw in a top-of-the-table clash.

properties.name: Genesis bookshop
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild On the corner, Genesis probably has the best range of Peru-related books in the city and a good assortment of novels. Prices are in the mid-range.

properties.name: Go lesbians
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild

properties.name: Got to The Beach before Leonardo
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Travelled with my Aussie mate Mark in December 1993 and January 1994 and from Krabi we went to Ko Phi Phi, which is where the movie was later shot (leading to complaints from environmentalists).

properties.name: Grey port
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Waited for the boat here longer than we expected or would have liked.

properties.name: Guilin
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild

properties.name: Had half my bike lock sawn through
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild It nearly all went wrong the first night of my cycling trip with Orlando from Malaga to Sevile in 2004, when we woke up to find the bikes we\'d left outside almost gone.

properties.name: Handed back a riot policeman his truncheon
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild The guy was forcing us back at the G8 summit on Wednesday 6th July 2005. When he stepped over a wire farmer\'s fence, he dropped his club. I thought about taking it and running but decided on the hippy way.

properties.name: Head in the Vatican
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Received in the gallery attached to St Peters in the summer of 2004.

properties.name: Hesco Military Products, Unit B, Molasses House, Plantation Wharf
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild

properties.name: Highbury, Arsenal
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild27th November 1982. Old Division 1. John Barnes scored twice as Watford won a thrilling match 4-2. Later we had a house-warming party and Trevor knocked the gas-fire over, setting light to the carpet.

properties.name: Home
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild 2000-present. Where I live with my gorgeous wife.

properties.name: Home Park, Plymouth Argyle
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild22nd March 2008, Championship. Rod drove Air, Jun and I down to Devon and Cornwall for the Easter weekend and we got to see the Horns go behind for just three minutes before Lee Williamson equalised with a free kick. They had a man sent off after half-time but didn\'t suffer for it and we finished equal.

properties.name: Home in Colchester, Lexden Road
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Lived with Chloe for six months in the converted basement of a detatched house. Colchester sucked.

properties.name: Home in Islington
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildThis is where I live with my wife in London, though I am from Watford. Hi!

properties.name: INSYS, Manning House, 22 Carlisle Place
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildCorporate HQ.

properties.name: Ice Encounter
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Another National Parks place, quite basic with no shelter. We saw Fox glacier in the morning and intended to get to Queenstown but stopped here instead.

properties.name: Ice Wharf, London
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildHi. This is home.

properties.name: Imperial Sword Company, Imperial House, 64 Willoughby Lane
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildNATO Supply Classifications: Badges and Insignia; Individual Equipment; Armour, Personal.

properties.name: Impersonated Ross Jenkins in my briefs
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild August 1994 on Gilli Trawangan. Was competing with Lindsey\'s bf to do the best version of how Jenkins used to head the ball into the net. Only problem was nobody else could judge...

properties.name: In cases down a passage
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Between two shops is a passage with cases of books at knee-height on the right-hand side. Fair selection, prices a bit above the best in Cuzco.

properties.name: Inside Central Artesanal Arte Inka
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild The usual guides etc but some surprisingly good prices too.

properties.name: Israeli Party Town
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Kept awake three nights in a row in two different places by "partying" ex-IDFers. Talking loudly and banging tables is a great way to let your hair down and make friends.

properties.name: J & S Franklin, 151 Strand
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildNATO Supply Classifications: Camouflage and Deception Equipment; Tents and Tarpaulins; Outerwear, Men´s; Individual Equipment; Armour, Personal.

properties.name: Jerusalen
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild 143 Heladeros, has the biggest and best range of second-hand books and a good choice of new books all at reasonable prices.

properties.name: Kenilworth Road, Luton Town.
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild4th March 1985. FA Cup 5th Round. Stood in the terrace of a dump and could only see the right wing for most of the match. 0-0.

properties.name: Key-cutting shop
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild The cheapest second-hand books in Cuzco. Unfortunately, there are very few of them and I bought the pick of them....

properties.name: LRLIH, New Zealand House, 80 Haymarket
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildHas controlling interest in Ashok, which agreed to supply army trucks to the Sudan Defence Ministry. Ashok allegedly contravened UK arms export legislation by entering into agreements to ship military specification vehicles to Sudan in 2005 in a BBC investigation.

properties.name: La Casa de Fray Bartolome
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Cusco´s biggest bookstore has a poor range of English novels, though there are a few nice and expensive coffee table tomes.

properties.name: La Senda Verde
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Volunteered at an animal refuge for 2 weeks, where I dealt with the monkeys and Jun looked after everything else: tortoises, rabbits, guinea pigs, dogs and parrots of every type.

properties.name: Last encounter with Chinese Police
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild In the hut on the Chinese side of the bridge, I pulled out a bottle of water and sipped from it only to see the unaccounted for piece of hash that I\'d been given in Xiahe. Slipped it into my mouth and washed it down as I waited for the policeman on the other side of the table to return my passport and let me cross into Vietnam.

properties.name: Lavenham, 22nd July
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildAl drove us to this medieval town to see the church and the old houses.

properties.name: Lewes, 29th July
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildWent for a seven and a half mile walk with Rob and Kelly.

properties.name: Liberty Libreria
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Not a bad range of novels.

properties.name: Little Peruvian Bookshop: Cultual Abracitos
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Has the usual Inca and Machu Picchu stuff. On the cheaper side, with some second-hand books.

properties.name: Local resistance: No to the antenna
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Spotted when apartment hunting.

properties.name: Loftus Road, Queens Park Rangers.
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild18th April 1981. Old Division 2. Dad drove me to the match, which finished 0-0 on their bouncy turf. 22nd September 2007. Championship. Took Joss to see us draw 1-1 and stay top of the league. Adam Johnson (on loan from Middlesbrough) scored.

properties.name: Looked into the Devil´s Throat
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Saw the 275 waterfalls of Iguazu after a night of rain in early May 2009. Saw a Cayman, butterflies and birds too.

properties.name: Los Cromistas: A few books hidden away
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Has a couple of piles of second hand novels as well as the usual. There were a few classics amongst the easy readers.

properties.name: Lost my virginity
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Easter 1987. Her name was Christine. She was from Rugby and I met and chatted her up at a chalet party on an 18 Plus holiday before taking her back to my chalet, where she said "no" and told me after (what seemed like) several hours that she was "only teasing". No meant yes.

properties.name: MATRA BAE Dynamics, 11 Strand
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildOffers more than 40 missiles and missile systems. Arms the Eurofighter. The holding company is MBDA, which is the first fully integrated, pan European defence company and is owned equally by BAE Systems (37.5%), EADS (37.5%) and Finmeccanica (25%). The Company is a world leading missile systems company with an annual turnover of 2 billion Euros, an order book of 15 billion Euros and over 70 customers worldwide. MBDA has 10,000 employees based across the UK, France, Italy and the USA. MBDA operates in all of the major world markets and is the only company in its sector able to design and produce missile systems for land-based, naval and airborne requirements. In addition, Alan Garwood, the present head of DESO, was seconded from MBDA.

properties.name: MATRA BAE Dynamics, 11 Strand
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildThere are revolving doors between the UK establishment and the largest European missile company. Politicians leave the Ministry of Defence and go into the pay of the arms companies as lobbyists. Alan Garwood, the present head of DESO, was seconded from MBDA.

properties.name: Machu Picchu Village
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild  Almost 2 nights at a better-than-advertised (by Lonely Planet) village, where we had a hot bath both evenings only to find out on the second (after visiting Machu Picchu) that there would be not trains the following day due to a strike. Some lying later, we were on the last train back to Ollantaytambo.

properties.name: Madejski Stadium, Reading
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildSaturday 5th May, 2007. Premiership. Joss, Jun and I travelled by train with Rod and Air to see Watford unexpectedly take all three points. Danny Shittu and Marlon King scored second-hlaf goals in our 2-0 victory.

properties.name: Magellanic and Humboldts
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild  Penguin watching off the coast of Chiloe.

properties.name: Mapuche nation!
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild

properties.name: Marvelfairs Ltd., Suite 44/45, Level 7, Westgate House, Westgate
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildManufacturer of uniforms and accessories for armed forces and uniformed services worldwide.

properties.name: Mekong boat trip
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Thought I was in for a unique trip in 1995 but ended up sharing with two Canadians in their forties (as well as Laos and tribespeople who called the boat from the bank, like a taxi). The Canadians drank too much at one village stop and one came back to the boat drunk, looking for condoms and singing "pussy". The idiots were vomiting all the next day...

properties.name: Mikuni Junior High School
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Worked as a JET teacher for 2 years here.

properties.name: Millenium Dome, 28th July
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildSaw Scissors Sisters with Air, Rod and Jun. Wasn\'t too impressed with the gig or the acoustics of the venue.

properties.name: Millennium Dome, 11th & 14th August
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildWent to two Prince concerts to see his purpleness play parts of his hits

properties.name: Millennium Stadium
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild21st May 2006. v Leeds United. Faisel drove me, Jun, Joss, Nevin and Luke\'s ticket to the great occasion to see the Yellow Army win 3-0 and return to the Premiership.

properties.name: Molineux, Wolverhampton Wanderers.
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild16th February 1980. FA Cup 5th Round Dad took me to the evening match and gave me my first sups of beer at half time. Watford won 3-0, Malcolm Poskett scored two and Luther Blissett scored the other.

properties.name: Mountain biked close to death
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Came down the mountain too fast in 1994 on a trip with Canadian Melissa and managed to brake at the edge of a forty metre drop. Just sat and looked over for a little while...

properties.name: My 2-bed apartment in Fukui
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Lived here for a year while i worked at Asuwa High School.

properties.name: My Japanese Homestay
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildSpent a few months at Dokkyo Daigaku and this was my home. The Nozawas are a lovely family who made me feel at home.

properties.name: My Japanese University
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildStudied here for 6 months (theoretically) from March 1997. Met Aya Isobe, who helped with my MA research.

properties.name: My PADI SCUBA Licence, Roatan.
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild January 2002, did my SCUBA licence in the Carribean on a great holiday with Jun.

properties.name: My first arrest, Langmusi
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild After a fight with a drunk Chinese policeman, September 1995.

properties.name: My first girlfriend
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild I was 8, Andrea Saunders (the daughter of my mum\'s friend since childhood) was 9 and I taught her how to jump off her swing and play dead. We had a kiss and exchanged letters intermittently for a few years, only ever meeting once again.

properties.name: My first home abroad: Sunny House 206
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild I lived here for 2 years from July 1992-July 1995 when working at the junior High School.

properties.name: My first schools
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Chater Infants and Chater Junior schools. Named after the do-gooder son of a local chemist. Teachers were Mrs Murtagh (sp?), Mrs Wright, Miss Davies and Mr Wheeler. I also had my most successful sporting period in my fourth year of junior school (1980-81) scoring 30-odd goals as centre forward for the school team.

properties.name: My first schools
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Chater Infants and Chater Junior schools. Named after the do-gooder son of a local chemist.

properties.name: My first trip abroad
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Day-trip to Calais as a first year at senior school, 1982. Left my first pair of sunglasses on the ferry.

properties.name: My girlfriend got married
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild I gave her away to the songs of The King, impersonated in this Las Vegas chapel.

properties.name: My last trip of the 20th Century, Colombia.
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Spent 3 months in Colombia, 5 weeks of which were in Cartagena, sweating through my 30th birthday and looking for some work.

properties.name: My second arrest, University of Essex.
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild It weren\'t me, guv.

properties.name: My second home: YMCA, Watford
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Lived in room 1017 for seven or eight months in 1988. Met Stan the man, Simon, Pete (Space Cadet) and Sweaty Sock Alan. Also spent time with New Zealander Michelle (who was looking for Adam Ant) and Diane and Claire...

properties.name: My second university, U of Essex
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildFirst 6 months of MA in Contemporary Japan

properties.name: My senior school, Durrants
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild  1981-1986. Got 7 O\' Levels and had my first French kiss (with Joanne Phelps). Left after a week or so in the sixth form because I couldn\'t do Maths and English A Levels.

properties.name: My third arrest, Tel Aviv
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Bloody violent Israeli police attacked peaceful demonstrators with boots, knees and fists: March 2004.

properties.name: My third home
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Lived here from 1988 to September 1989 with Sophia and Maria

properties.name: My unsuccessful DJ career
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Did a few Wednesday nights at what was then Precinct 13, spinning Native Tonuges, rap and a little ragga. Then they replaced me with someone good.

properties.name: Near the LoTR Volcanos
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Jun was not feeling well enough for the Tongariro crossing so we did the Silica Rapids walk instead.

properties.name: Near the rock wallabies
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild

properties.name: New Salt Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild  First night of the tour: stayed in a hotel made of salt near a village on the edge of the flats and were delayed by about two hours in the morning. The location marker is only VERY approximate.

properties.name: New Year 2009 in Currarong
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Stayed with John and a pregnant Therese for 31st Dec and 1st Jan and did some snorkelling.

properties.name: Night in the capital
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild We weren\'t overly impressed with Montevideo, but it was there, so....

properties.name: Oak House, halls of residence
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Lived here in my first year at Manchester University 1989-90. Shared with 7 or 8 other guys including Uppi, Gary, and two Steves.

properties.name: Offered camels for wife
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild A guy in Marrakesh market made an offer for Jun, but i couldn\'t get the price (in dromedaries) I was looking for.

properties.name: Old Trafford, Manchester United
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild31st January 2007. Premiership. Joss and I travelled up by train to see a 4-0 thrashing and then Deyika picked us up and we stayed at his.

properties.name: Otherworldly adventure
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild  Spent three days and two freezing nights on a tour of the amazing Salar de Uyuni.

properties.name: Our first holiday rental
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild After a couple of nights round the corner on Londres, we rented from an Irishman named Connor. We were on the 21st floor.

properties.name: Pacha Mia
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild A few books on Cusco and Peru. Try the two shops either side of this.

properties.name: Painted Art Deco
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Redecorated Brian and Kaori\'s apartment in summer 1998.

properties.name: Palafitos (houses on stilts)
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Went out on a little boat to see the palafitos, which weren\'t quite as colouful as I had expected.

properties.name: Paradise with pricks
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild In Novemeber 99, went from Cartagena to the national park with a mate and endured the company of an arsehole Brit and a separate arsehole American. Hammocks, tents, sun and sea.

properties.name: Picked up by Japanese police
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Mark and I were attempting to hitch to Tokyo from Fukui in 1993. We got quite far before getting stopped and taken to a bus stop by the local constabulary. Stupidly, i showed them my "gaijin card" and the whole incident was mentioned at school a few months down the line.

properties.name: Puro Peru
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild A reasonable range at the front and then a ridiculously large and hard to navigate pile of second hand books in the back.

properties.name: Rafael, 3/5 Duke Street
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildIsraeli arms producer of Gill Spike Missiles, used in Palestine and Lebanon. Also accused of using weapons with radioactive elements.

properties.name: Rain broke a contact lens
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Kaori, my then-girlfriend\'s contact lens was broken by a sudden downpour on the day in 1998 that Bill Clinton was debating the meaning of the "be" verb with Ken Starr.

properties.name: Ran with bulls
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild

properties.name: Raytheon Systems Ltd., 80 Park Lane
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild

properties.name: Recovery town
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Jun didn´t go to Torres del Paine, citing a cold, and I came back from the national park after one day having come down with something. We spent a few nights in Puerto Natales recovering before a longish bus journey north to El Bolson.

properties.name: Reed Elsevier, 1-3 Strand
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildReed Elsevier are the company responsible for organising the DSEi arms fair and other arms fairs around the world which help to faclitate the global arms trade. There is a vigil every Wednesday outside their HQ between 12 and 2.

properties.name: Rented a bedsit
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Stayed a few nights before heading to Qosqo to meet Julie - though the strike around Sicuani slowed our progress. Found out about the trouble in the jungle in the north and got a picture published by Al Jazeera from the protest here.

properties.name: Rolls Royce, 65 Buckingham Gate
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildEquipment to Indonesia and the Middle East

properties.name: SERCO Group, 22 Hand Court
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildWorks with Israel Aircraft Industries, designing and building aircraft and avionics equipment.

properties.name: SPEAR Communications, 58 Grosvenor Street, W1K 3JB
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildSpecial Operations Forces Personal Equipment Advanced Requirements (SPEAR) is the United States Special Operations Command\'s (USSOCOM) modernization effort for the joint (Army, Navy, and Air Force) Special Operations Forces (SOF) operator. SPEAR will focus on four areas of improvement in personal equipment from 1996 - 2005 including the Modular/Integrated Communications Helmet (MICH). The SPEAR MICH provides the SOF operator the flexibility to tailor ballistic/impact protection and communications to the mission using one modular system. MICH is a modular helmet system that provides ballistic, fragmentation, aural and impact protection, while being night vision, communications and Nuclear, Biological and Chemical (NBC) equipment compatible. The MICH is intended to replace standard government and commercial helmets, communications and aural protection items currently in use. The MICH helmet and is compatible with standard and SOF-unique clothing and individual equipment. The ballistic helmet provides 9mm (handgun) and fragmentation protection within the spectrum of environments (climatic, salt water, fresh water, POL, etc). The helmet allows maximum sensory awareness for the user, which includes unobstructed field of view and ambient hearing capabilities. It also allows mounting of night vision devices and oxygen masks. The helmet\'s retention/suspension system provides maximum balance, stability and comfort, while providing the proper size, fit and ventilation. The pad suspension system provides adequate impact protection throughout all joint SOF operations, to include Static Line and Military Free Fall airborne operations. The ballistic helmet, retention system and pad suspension system may be worn with or without the communications subsystem. Although molded like the current, standard-issue Personnel Armor System, Ground Troops (PASGT) helmet in use since the early 1980s, the MICH trims away the edge for improved visibility, unobstructed hearing, reduced weight (less than 3 pounds without communication equipment) and easier integration with body armor. Until the MICH, there had never been a helmet designed to stop bullets. The MICH uses a different version of Kevlar combined with different bonding techniques to form a shell capable of halting a submachine gun\'s 9 mm round in addition to protecting against fragmentation. The PASGT Kevlar helmet only protects against fragmentation and at most can deflect bullets. The communication subsystem is intended to provide aural protection as well as a dual channel communications capability. The subsystem provides aural protection, occluding and non-occluding communications, omni-directional hearing, ear-specific communications (dual channel), low profile microphone(s), microphone adapter for mask microphone, multiple radio and intercom adapters, and push-to-talk access. The headset may be worn alone or with the ballistic helmet retention system and pad suspension system. The communications subsystem is designed to be included with the helmet, and because of its modularity, the MICH can be configured to each specific group with or without the added equipment. The subsystem is intended to provide aural protection and dual-channel communications capability. It offers features such as a low-profile microphone, microphone adapter for mask microphone, multiple radio and intercom adapters, and push-to-talk access. The headset may be worn alone or with the helmet. What would allow the wearer to stay conscious if hit is the innovative seven-pad suspension system. The current helmet uses a bolted-on nylon suspension with a leather headband that is fastened onto the inside headband. Many users would buy a circular pad to ease the weight stress on top of their heads. Suspension pads consist of a comfort foam and "slow memory" foam to absorb shock. The cloth covering wicks away moisture to keep users cooler. The MICH suspension pads are composed partly of comfort foam where the pads touch the head and mostly of "slow-memory" impact foam with the resilience of a wrestling mat. The foam is like a shock tling mat. The foam is like a shock absorber against a striking bullet. A black CoolMax cloth covering wicks moisture away and helps the user stay cooler. Lining the inside is a glued-on strip of Velcro fastener. Users can unhook and adjust the pads to create a custom fit. An improved strap attaches at four points on the helmet while retaining the chin pocket for a more secure fit. Also remarkably different from the current helmet is the four-point instead of two-point chinstrap. The two-strap "pocket" at the chin remains the same, but instead of anchoring to the helmet over the ear, one strap in front and behind the ear on each side securely clamp down the MICH. Airborne operations are easier because the MICH requires no shock pad to prevent whiplash while descending or retention strap. Two features of the MICH reduce logistics. It\'s made in medium and large with different sized pads used to account for the vast majority of sizes in between, and the helmet cover is reversible for woodland and desert camouflage. The PASGT helmet uses separate covers and is issued in five sizes.

properties.name: Sang our version of Don´t Cry for Me
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild At the Sapporo Dome, on the cue of an off-target shot, four of us (Emma, Ben, John) in unison burst into "Don\'t cry for me Argentina, the truth is he always misses. He\'s fucking useless. He\'s fucking useless. Batistuta: what a wanker." It got more laughs on the train back, though, after we held on to a single-goal lead in the "Group of Death". 7th June 2002.

properties.name: Saudi Arabian Embassy, 60 Queen Anne Street
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildHuman rights abuser and participant in the corrupt Al-Yamamah deal, which Tony Blair forced the attorney general, Lord Goldsmith, to drop.

properties.name: Saw a great white (tipped reef) shark
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild On a night dive at the Great Barrier Reef, saw a sleeping turtle, a potato cod and had an encounter with a two-and-a-half metre long shark.

properties.name: Saw our first kea
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Stopped at a national parks campsite, think I saw a kiwi chick walking on the road just before we got here. Cheap and cheerful accomodation with a shelter we could cook in.

properties.name: Sealions
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Lovely little town with sealions and hawks taking advantage of the fish market and a Kunstmann brewery a bus ride away.

properties.name: Sealions and Penguins
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild  Paracas desert meets the Pacific. Great boat trip and tour.

properties.name: Second in the county: the height of my sporting career
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Won a pink certificate for coming second at the Hertfordshire school games in the pole-vault in 1982. I was the only one of the competitiors without a fibre-glass pole (my didn\'t bend). Broke my school\'s records at the same time (for 1st to 5th year).

properties.name: Self-enforced solitary sent me slightly mad
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Spent five weeks reading, smoking, doing press-ups and writing in early 1996. Hardly spoke to anyone and found my brain wandering away from my head ("Zen and the art of motorcycle maintenance" didn\'t help).

properties.name: Shining Path beginnings
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Hotel Marcos. Ayacucho is said to have 33 colonial churches (one for each year of Jesus´ life) but it was the Museo de la Memoria which made the biggest impact.

properties.name: Shortest ever visit to a country
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild About 45 minutes after crossing the Nicaraguan border into Costa Rica (and changing all our money), Jun and I had to go back because they wouldn\'t accept her visa. (2002)

properties.name: Signature Industries, Tom Cribb Road, Thamesmead
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildNATO Supply Classifications: Parachutes; Aerial Pick Up, Delivery, Recovery Systems; and Cargo Tie Down Equipment; Safety and Rescue Equipment; Miscellaneous Communication Equipment;

properties.name: Slashed with a knife
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild In 2000, I sobered up on my feet face-to-face with a guy holding a knife to me. I had no recollection of how I\'d got into that situation but just asked him what he was going to do about it and walked off. Walking down York Way, I realised he had slashed my jacket: it felt like a lucky escape (and reminded me of a passage in John Irving\'s "Cider House Rules").

properties.name: Slid away from tombs
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Hiked up the mountain to see the looted underground vaults. It started raining and my newly resoled DMs fell apart as I tried to descend. There were a few hairy moments before I got back to tracks.

properties.name: Slow boat to China
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Left Japan from Osaka in August 1995 and arrived in Shanghai 36 hours later.

properties.name: Smiths Aerospace, Vulcan Way, New Addington
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildSmiths Group, through its Aerospace business, is a first-tier supplier to UK and US aircraft and engine manufacturers. It produces \'integrated aerospace systems, including electronic and actuation systems and components for civil and military aircraft. Also equipment for land, naval and marine and other defence applications.\'3 Gun pods for Hawk jets, gun-turret actuators for Apache attack helicopters and cockpit control panels for the B-2 bomber, F-16 fighter and the A-10A \'tank-buster\' provide a few examples of their products.4 The proportion of Smiths\' work that is military is steadily increasing. Smiths\' 2002 Annual Review states that the reduction in civil aircraft production \'was counterbalanced by rising requirements for our military aerospace and detection products. We have established strong market positions in both military and detection and expect sales to grow strongly over the next few years.\'5 The Annual Review goes on to state that \'the biggest business win of the year was the F-35 fighter aircraft [the Joint Strike Fighter], where we have secured business worth around m per plane... More than 3,000 F-35s are planned to be built and the programme should make a major contribution to the division\'s long-term growth.\' The Joint Strike Fighter (JSF) is set to replace the F-16, the most numerous western fighter in service, and is anticipated to be exported around the world. Israel and Turkey are already formally involved in the programme, even before the aircraft is ready for production. In 2002, Smiths received unwelcome attention amid the growing concern over Israeli activities in the Occupied Territories - it was reported by the Guardian that missile trigger systems made by Smiths Group were used in US-made Apache attack helicopters supplied to Israel.6 However, such revelations are rare - not because Smiths\' equipment is not being used by oppressive regimes or in regions of conflict or tension, but because we generally hear only about the company that markets the complete weapons system. Smiths\' military involvement is far less widely known than its size merits.

properties.name: Smiths, 459 Park Avenue, Bushey
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildSmiths Group, through its Aerospace business, is a first-tier supplier to UK and US aircraft and engine manufacturers. It produces \'integrated aerospace systems, including electronic and actuation systems and components for civil and military aircraft. Also equipment for land, naval and marine and other defence applications.\'3 Gun pods for Hawk jets, gun-turret actuators for Apache attack helicopters and cockpit control panels for the B-2 bomber, F-16 fighter and the A-10A \'tank-buster\' provide a few examples of their products.4 The proportion of Smiths\' work that is military is steadily increasing. However, such revelations are rare - not because Smiths\' equipment is not being used by oppressive regimes or in regions of conflict or tension, but because we generally hear only about the company that markets the complete weapons system. Smiths\' military involvement is far less widely known than its size merits.

It produces \'integrated aerospace systems, including electronic and actuation systems and components for civil and military aircraft. Also equipment for land, naval and marine and other defence applications.\'3 Gun pods for Hawk jets, gun-turret actuators for Apache attack helicopters and cockpit control panels for the B-2 bomber, F-16 fighter and the A-10A \'tank-buster\' provide a few examples of their products.4 The proportion of Smiths\' work that is military is steadily increasing. Smiths\' military involvement is far less widely known than its size merits.

properties.name: Some fresh air
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild After two months in La Paz, we had five nights in Coroico, where we went for long walks every day and enjoyed the vultures before going to volunteer at the animal refuge we had heard about in Samaipata a few months previously.

properties.name: Sperm Whale Watching
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Took a whale-watching tour and saw 3 of the enormous beasts at the surface.

properties.name: Stadio San Siro
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildLuther moved to AC Milan for £1 million in the summer of 1983 but only made 30 appearances (scoring 5 times) before rejoining Watford for a cut-price £550,000 in the summer of \'84.

properties.name: Stamford Bridge, Chelsea
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild11th November 2006. Premiership. Joss and I went by train to see us get hammered 4-0. Didier Drogba was on blistering form.

properties.name: Started supporting Vasca
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Eduardo took Jun and I to a Copa Brasil match while we were staying with Andrea and him in Rio, May 2009. Vasco de Gama beat Vitoria 4-0 in the semi-final first leg.

properties.name: Telscombe Cliffs, 29th July
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildThis is where the walk ended. We had a few pints in the Badger\'s Watch.

properties.name: Thales Avionics Ltd, 86-88 Bushey Road, Raynes Park
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildThales, a French company, has swallowed up such familiar names as Racal, Thomson Marconi Sonar, Shorts Missile Systems, Thorn, Avimo and Pilkington Optronics,4 and is now the UK\'s second largest military supplier. It is involved with the UK\'s new aircraft carrier programmes, is to provide sonar suites for the Astute class submarine and it states that \'our advanced missile electronics products are used in almost every UK missile.\'5

properties.name: The Hawthorns, West Bromwich Albion
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild12th April 2008 Top of the table clash that Joss and I went up to with Jun and stayed at Mum\'s for the night.

properties.name: The Real McCoy
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild The English pub has a fairly good range of books for sale or exchange but the prices for the best of them are ridiculous. Some used books are more expensive than a new one a ten minute walk away.

properties.name: The Valley, Charlton Athletic
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild 28th January 1984. FA Cup 4th Round. (the old Valley) Dad drove us to see a 2-0 victory, with Johnston and Reilly getting the goals. 21st October 2006. Premiership. Took Joss by train to watch a 0-0 draw. (the new Valley)

properties.name: The Vic, Watford
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildFebruary 3rd 1979: Old League Division 3. Dad asked me a day or two before the match if I supported Watford and wanted to go to the match. Ross Jenkins scored 2 in our 2-2 draw with Rotherham. That season we were promoted and within five we had beaten all the big teams, finished second in the country and got to the FA Cup Final at Wembley. I have been to about 200 games here. My dad brought my sisters and brother once or twice but I went to just about every home game until he died in March 1987. What with university and living and travelling abroad, I had about an eight year break but started going with friends when I returned to the UK (London). Since the early years of the millennium, I\'ve taken three of my nephews, my wife and a few Japanese friends. I have a season ticket in the Rookery.

properties.name: The Vic, Watford.
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildLuther started out at Watford in 1975 and made 246 appearances, scoring 95 goals in the process. After a year in Italy (1983/84), he returned to the Vic for another four years, making 127 appearances and scoring 44 more goals. His third playing term here lasted one season (1991/92), when he played 42 times and scored 10 goals. Luther holds records for the most appearances and goals for Watford (415 & 158 respectively). Luther also worked as a coach at Watford from 1996 to 2001. He is a living Watford legend.

properties.name: The furthest I've travelled for a party
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Our friend Jan celebrated his 40th in Finland. We spent time with Matt and Kung, Jan and his wife Ying, and lots of his family and friends. Guitar playing and sing-alongs made up the evenings\' entertainment.

properties.name: The horror
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildAuschwitz concentration camp, Poland. Visited with Jun in 2001 to bear witness to the final solution.

properties.name: The jungle and pueblos
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild The map does not show details of the rivers and villages in the Peruvian Amazon but we spent four days and three nights travelling in this (approximate) region. The first pueblo (night 1) was Saposohillo, where we went crocodile spotting. We spent the second night in the jungle near a lick and the third in a "pueblo libre" (cleared of jungle) called Santa Rosa de Callaria.

properties.name: The most I've ever won in a casino
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Well, let\'s be clear, it wasn\'t much: about £40 in July 2000 with Jun on blackjack.

properties.name: The night before the flats
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Spent a night here having arranged our 3 day trip for the following day.

properties.name: Thought we were nearer the centre.
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Rented a nice apartment for a couple of days. It was far out, but the beginning of the boat into the harbour.

properties.name: Three nights in extreme town
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Caught up with Anthony and Yulia here and I did "Nevis", New Zealand\'s highest bungee jump.

properties.name: Threw myself out of a plane
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Did my first static line jump in November 2006 and my second in March 2007 at the North London Parachute Centre

properties.name: Thrown out of Genghis Khan's mausoleum
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Am I a barbarian? Just because i filmed...

properties.name: Too much rain to raft
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Hitchiked to and from this little town after Jun refused to stay in Chaiten when we got off the boat. Wanted to raft but the weather and a poor choice of operator prevented it.

properties.name: Too sexy for the catwalk
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Model for a night at Club Yellow. A friend of my homestay brother, Tomo, designed various bits of casual wear and I offered my services. They started to shave my hair but the shaver broke and i was left with a weird haircut that caught the attention of the photographers and i was (apparently) on the front of some little newspaper.

properties.name: Too sexy for the catwalk
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild

properties.name: Tourist shop on the plaza
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild The usual type of place only with a reasonable range of novels too. Not the best prices in Cusco, though.

properties.name: Town with an enormous cross
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild

properties.name: Travel Agency with books
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild A few of the usual Cusco and Peru guides.

properties.name: Tried to get into prison
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Demo with Palestinian, Israeli and foreign protesters about the "prison" that the illegal Israeli occupying forces have made the Gaza strip.

properties.name: Triple Towers
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild One night and an 8hr trek to the towers with Jackie and Ximena.

properties.name: Twenty-six nights
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Rented a 3-bed place until 1st Nov and I got a job in "the highest Irish-owned pub in the world" as well as volunteering at a police station in an Aldea Yanapay project.

properties.name: Two months of insufflation
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Rented a two-bed flat on the 12th floor of a café-culture residential area, and spent a lot of time watching YouTube videos and reading about history, religion, evolution, the big bang, abiogenesis and medium´s tricks such as cold-reading and Barnum statements.

properties.name: Two nights in two Nara hostels
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Stayed in a ryokan after the police were called when we tried to leave having pre-booked. The second night was opposite the station.

properties.name: Ultra Electronic Holdings, 417/9 Bridport Road, Greenford
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild

properties.name: Upton Park, West Ham United
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild27th January 2007. FA Cup 4th Round. Joss, Julie and I saw the Golden Boys progress after winning 1-0. 10th February 2007. Premiership. Joss and I came back two weeks later to see us win by the same score in a six-pointer.

properties.name: Views of Sugar Loaf
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Andrea and Eduardo put us up for a week after our first night in a dormitory around a couple of corners. Our hosts lent us bicycles and we spent the days getting different views of Christ the Redeemer and the Sugar Loaf. Went to a football match and declared Vasco de Gama my Brazilian team.

properties.name: Villa Jennifer
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild  Danish-Peruvian couple run a great place with caged primates (first time seeing tamarin and marmoset), alligators and birds.

properties.name: Villa Park, Aston Villa
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild14th April 1984. Watford v Plymouth Argyle. FA Cup Semi-Final.Dad drove here and we watched the Golden Boys reach Wembley with a 1-0 victory. George Reilly scored.13th April 2003. Watford v Southampton. FA Cup Semi-Final.Faisel drove me, Jun, Luke and Joss here to see us go down 2-1 to the Saints.20th January 1=2007. v Aston Villa. Premeriship.We came by train and after the match, Joss and I met up with Jun in Birmingham, ate dinner with Tessa and stayed at Pauline and Brian\'s. April 14th 2007 v Manchester United (FA Cup Semi Final) Jun, Joss, Jan and I travelled on a special train to Aston at the end of a week in which United had beaten Roma 7-1. Hameur Bouazza scored a great overhead goal but we went down 4-1.

properties.name: Waipara Sleepers
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild  An interesting "station" themed campsite we stayed at after the drive from Lake Alexandrina on the way to Kaikoura.

properties.name: Watch the Horns win the  (then) most lucrative game in football ever
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Watford beat Leeds 3-0 in May 2006, to win the Championship Play-Off final, the single most lucrative football match in the world (to date).

properties.name: Waterloo Sunset - The Kinks
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild

properties.name: Wedding, 21st August 2002, London.
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Jun and I tied the knot here with Gosia and Yumi as our only witnesses.

properties.name: Wembley Stadium
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild19th May 1984. Watford v Everton. FA Cup Final. Dad took Trevor and I on the Metropolitan Line to see us go down 2-0. 31st May 1999. Watford v Bolton Wanderers Division One Play-Off Final. Faisel and I went down on the train to see a glorious overhead kick by Nick Wright help us win 2-0. Met up with Asif after the match.

properties.name: Wembley Stadium, England
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildLuther made fourteen appearances for England, scoring all three of his goals in a debut hat-trick against Luxembourg.

properties.name: Whale watching
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Saw three sperm whales before setting off for the North Island the following day.

properties.name: White Hart Lane, Tottenham Hotspur
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildSpurs v Watford 17th March 2007. Premiership. Joss and I went along to see their keeper score past ours in a 3-1 defeat. Darius Henderson got our late consolation.

properties.name: With the Matkin-Kosakas
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Stayed at Kahori and Orlando´s for 2 nights and played Geosense with Maya and Mina.

properties.name: Won (money at) the Derby
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Went down to Epsom to meet Air & Rod, Jade & Oliver and some others. Won about £20 on the winner of the Derby, Alternative Future (this after winning £70 on the National earlier in the year) but was down about £13 in total on all the races of the day.

properties.name: Won a TV Quiz
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild End of June 2003 I took part in "Beat the Nation", a low budget Endemol quiz for Channel 4 that only managed one season. Twice, I beat my opponents but couldn\'t beat the nation. Third time I went out in the final round but picked up £100 with my goodbye question.

properties.name: Won a laughing competition, Malacca, Malaysia.
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild Won a flight to Phuket on Xmas Eve 1993. The competition was as cringeworthy as it sounds, with two guys making ridiculous noises and two gals refusing to take part once they realised what they were supposed to do. I started with a quiet chuckle to myself and built slowly up until I was on my back on the floor, kicking and punching in hysterics. Got myself a genuine laugh or two...

properties.name: Worked at the highest Irish-owned pub in the world
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild  Got a job at Paddy\'s (owner was named Gary) in October 2009 and worked two or three evenings until January 2010.

properties.name: World´s largest carved rock
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild   After a rock slide outside Santa Cruz held us up, we arrived in Samaipata in the dark and met Zac on the street. We got a hostel together and stayed with cute kittens (and their fleas) for a couple of nights, seeing the rock, watching Man U lose to Barcelona and dancing at a Mother´s Day party.

properties.name: stadium:mk, 1st Aug
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildTook Joss to watch Watford draw 0-0 in a pre-season friendly

properties.name: stadium:mk, Milton Keynes Dons
properties.description: Posted by BoringlovechildJoss and I went up by train for a preseason friendly (1st August 2007) and found ourselves in a queue that wound round the car park. We missed a fair bit of the first half but the game ended 0-0.

properties.name: ¨Art Gallery¨
properties.description: Posted by Boringlovechild The usual plus a handful of secondhand books.
